content: The Act may be cited as the "COPS Improvements Act of 2011" and includes improvements to COPS grants. The "COPS Improvements Act of 2011" amends the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 by establishing the Office of Community Oriented Policing Services within the Department of Justice, headed by a Director with final authority over grants, agreements, and contracts. The "COPS Improvements Act of 2011" establishes the Office of Community Oriented Policing Services within the Department of Justice, granting the Attorney General authority to make grants for community policing and crime prevention purposes. The "COPS Improvements Act of 2011" establishes the Office of Community Oriented Policing Services within the Department of Justice, granting the Attorney General authority to make grants for community policing and crime prevention purposes. The Act includes provisions to award grants for hiring school resource officers and establishing school-based partnerships between law enforcement agencies and school systems to address crime, gangs, drug activities, and other issues in and around schools. The "COPS Improvements Act of 2011" establishes innovative programs to reduce illegal drug activities, including methamphetamine manufacturing. It also awards grants for enhancing community policing and crime prevention efforts.
